verses.kjv: And Moses went up from the plains of Moab unto the mountain of Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, that is over against Jericho. And the LORD shewed him all the land of Gilead, unto Dan,
verses.ct: Moses climbed from the plains of Moab up Mount Nebo, to the peak of Pisgah, which faces Jericho. There the LORD showed him the entire land — all of Gilead as far as Dan,

verses.kjv: And all Naphtali, and the land of Ephraim, and Manasseh, and all the land of Judah, unto the utmost sea,
verses.ct: all of Naphtali, the territory of Ephraim and Manasseh, and all the territory of Judah stretching to the Mediterranean Sea,

verses.kjv: And the south, and the plain of the valley of Jericho, the city of palm trees, unto Zoar.
verses.ct: the Negev region, and the Jordan Valley around Jericho — the city of palm trees — all the way to Zoar.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto him, This is the land which I sware unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob, saying, I will give it unto thy seed: I have caused thee to see it with thine eyes, but thou shalt not go over thither.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told him, "This is the land I promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob when I said, 'I will give it to your descendants.' I have let you see it with your own eyes, but you will not cross over into it."

verses.kjv: So Moses the servant of the LORD died there in the land of Moab, according to the word of the LORD.
verses.ct: So Moses, the servant of the LORD, died there in the land of Moab, just as the LORD had said.

verses.kjv: And he buried him in a valley in the land of Moab, over against Bethpeor: but no man knoweth of his sepulchre unto this day.
verses.ct: God buried him in a valley in the land of Moab, across from Beth-peor, but no one knows where his tomb is to this day.

verses.kjv: And Moses was an hundred and twenty years old when he died: his eye was not dim, nor his natural force abated.
verses.ct: Moses was 120 years old when he died. His eyesight was still sharp, and his strength had not faded.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days: so the days of weeping and mourning for Moses were ended.
verses.ct: The Israelites mourned for Moses on the plains of Moab for 30 days. Then the period of grieving and mourning for Moses came to an end.

verses.kjv: And Joshua the son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom; for Moses had laid his hands upon him: and the children of Israel hearkened unto him, and did as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: Joshua son of Nun was filled with the spirit of wisdom, because Moses had placed his hands on him. The Israelites listened to Joshua and followed the instructions the LORD had given through Moses.

verses.kjv: And there arose not a prophet since in Israel like unto Moses, whom the LORD knew face to face,
verses.ct: No prophet has ever risen in Israel like Moses, whom the LORD knew personally and intimately,

verses.kjv: In all the signs and the wonders, which the LORD sent him to do in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh, and to all his servants, and to all his land,
verses.ct: considering all the miraculous signs and wonders the LORD sent him to perform in Egypt against Pharaoh, all his officials, and his entire land,

verses.kjv: And in all that mighty hand, and in all the great terror which Moses shewed in the sight of all Israel.
verses.ct: and all the displays of extraordinary power and the tremendous acts of wonder that Moses carried out in front of all Israel.
